title: 106_s3206
content: The Act may be cited as the "Victims of Rape Health Protection Act" and includes a provision for Byrne Grant reduction for noncompliance. The "Victims of Rape Health Protection Act" includes a provision for Byrne Grant reduction for noncompliance related to sex offender HIV testing. States must demonstrate compliance with HIV testing laws for defendants involved in sexual crimes involving force or threat of force. The "Victims of Rape Health Protection Act" requires defendants in sexual crimes that put the victim at risk of HIV infection to undergo a test if requested by the victim within 48 hours of indictment or request. The "Victims of Rape Health Protection Act" mandates defendants in sexual crimes endangering the victim with HIV to undergo a test upon the victim's request within 48 hours of indictment. The test results must be kept confidential, but made available to the victim and defendant or their legal guardian promptly. States can limit the victim's disclosure of the defendant's test results to third parties. The "Victims of Rape Health Protection Act" requires defendants in sexual crimes endangering the victim with HIV to undergo a test upon the victim's request. The test results must be kept confidential but made available to the victim and defendant promptly. Funds available for redistribution will be redistributed to participating States. The "Victims of Rape Health Protection Act" mandates HIV testing for defendants in sexual crimes endangering the victim. Funds will be redistributed to compliant States. The Attorney General will ensure compliance through regulations. Amendments are made to the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 for funding programs, including HIV testing for defendants. Effective date provisions are included. The amendments made by subsections (a) and (b) of the "Victims of Rape Health Protection Act" will take effect on the first day of the fiscal year succeeding the first fiscal year beginning 2 years after the enactment of the Act. The amendment made by subsection (c) regarding funding will take effect on the date of enactment.
